column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=Example 4

#Text=This example illustrates preparation of a Ce,Zr mixed-metal-oxide-promoted support according to the method of the present invention using ZrO(NO.sub.3).sub.2 and Ce nitrate (Ce/Zr atom ratio=0.9) in the presence of citric acid where the mole ratio of citric acid to the nitrate salts was 1.9:1.

#Text=85.7 grams of ZrO(NO.sub.3).sub.2.XH.sub.2 O (25.7 wt. % Zr) were dissolved in 300 grams of deionized water. 10 grams of conc. nitric acid were also added so as to aid in the dissolution of the Zr nitrate salt.
#Text=To this solution was added 151 grams of a Ce nitrate stock solution (20 wt. % Ce) followed by 166 grams of anhydrous citric acid.
#Text=The solution was stirred until all the citric acid was dissolved. 200 grams of .gamma.
#Text=-Al.sub.2 O.sub.3 were then added slowly to give a uniform slurry, which was milled for 2 minutes and then transferred to a flat ceramic dish.
#Text=The slurry was dried, then calcined at 600.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=(initially in 4%O.sub.2 /96%N.sub.2 for 6 hours followed by air at 600.degree.
#Text=C. for 1 hour).
#Text=After this the powder was aged at 1140.degree.
#Text=C. for 6 hours in 10%H.sub.2 O/90%N.sub.2.
#Text=After drying and calcination as described, a sample was removed from the top and bottom of the cake, aged and then analyzed using X-Ray diffraction (XRD).
#Text=The CeO.sub.2 lattice parameter for the sample removed from the bottom of the cake was 5.320.+-.0.009 .ANG. and from the top, the lattice parameter was 5.320.+-.0.007 .ANG..
#Text=Thus, it appeared that extensive doping of the CeO.sub.2 lattice occurred and there was no evidence for selective wicking of the various metal ions during drying and calcination.
#Text=The lattice parameters measured correspond to a Zr-doping level of the CeO.sub.2 lattice of 31.3 mole %.
#Text=Transmission electron spectroscopy (TEM) analysis of an identically prepared powder was carried out after calcination at 600.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Dispersed CeO.sub.2 particles having an average diameter of 60 .ANG. were observed in both the dark field and bright field transmission electron spectroscopy (TEM) analysis of the powder.
#Text=EDS analysis showed that the Ce and Zr were uniformly distributed throughout the sample, however, it was not possible to determine if solid solution formation had occurred.
#Text=Aged powders were also sent for transmission electron spectroscopy (TEM) analysis.
#Text=The aging consisted of heating to 1140.degree.
#Text=C. in 10%H.sub.2 O/90%N.sub.2 for 6 hours.
#Text=The CeO.sub.2 /ZrO.sub.2 particles had now grown to an average size of over 100 .ANG. and clearer diffraction from the CeO.sub.2 /ZrO.sub.2 particles was observed.
#Text=The diffraction analysis indicated the formation of a Ce.sub.0.75 Zr.sub.0.25 O.sub.2 phase showing that solid solution formation had occurred between the CeO.sub.2 and ZrO.sub.2.
